sense.gloss: bottom card of the draw pile
tasting (a nobleman's) medicine to see if it contains poison, medicine taster
to lick, to lap, to suck
to look down on (someone), to make fun of, to put down, to treat with contempt, to underestimate
to lick (at; of flames), to burn
to lick something up, to lap something up
currying favour (favor), brown-nosing, bootlicking, sucking pus from carbuncles and licking hemorrhoids (haemorrhoids)
licking one's lips (at the sight of appetizing food)
licking one's lips (in anticipation), waiting eagerly (for), salivating (e.g. at the thought)
to lick all over, to run one's tongue over
licking one's chopsticks (a breach of etiquette)

sdata.j: その↑子犬↑↓こいぬ↓は↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓の↑頬↑↓ほお↓を↑舐↑↓な↓めた。
sdata.e: The puppy licked her on the cheek.

sdata.j: ↑顔↑↓かお↓をべろべろ↑舐↑↓な↓めるな。わはは。↑止↑↓や↓めろよ。
sdata.e: Don't slobber over my face! A-ha-ha-ha. Stop it!

sdata.j: 「そんなに↑舐↑↓な↓められた↑相手↑↓あいて↓じゃないけどなぁ・・・」「そうだよ、↑窮鼠↑↓きゅうそ↓↑猫↑↓ねこ↓を↑噛↑↓か↓むって↑言↑↓い↓うじゃないか」
sdata.e: I don't think she's an opponent you can ignore like that ... "That's right, they say a cornered rat bites back, don't they?"

sdata.j: ↑脱水↑↓だっすい↓↑症状↑↓しょうじょう↓には、↑塩↑↓しお↓をひと↑舐↑↓な↓め。
sdata.e: For dehydration, take a lick of salt.

sdata.j: ここのソースは↑舐↑↓な↓めてみるとちょっと↑塩↑↓しょ↓っぱい。
sdata.e: If you taste this sauce you'll find it a bit salty.

sdata.j: たまにはビール↑以外↑↓いがい↓のお↑酒↑↓さけ↓をちびちび↑舐↑↓な↓めるのも↑良↑↓よ↓いでしょう。
sdata.e: It's nice to sip and savour drinks other than beer as well from time to time.

sdata.j: ↑煙草↑↓たばこ↓を↑吸↑↓す↓う↑人↑↓ひと↓とキスをするのは↑灰皿↑↓はいざら↓を↑舐↑↓な↓めるようなものだ。
sdata.e: Kissing a person who smokes is like licking an ashtray.

sdata.j: ↑煙草↑↓たばこ↓を↑吸↑↓す↓う↑人↑↓ひと↓とキスをするのは↑灰皿↑↓はいざら↓を↑舐↑↓な↓めるようなものだ。
sdata.e: Kissing a smoker is like licking an ashtray.

sdata.j: ↑猫↑↓ねこ↓がトムのこと↑舐↑↓な↓めたんだよ。

words.gloss: to lick, to lap, to suck
to lick something up, to lap something up
